intro: Dehaasia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered dehaasia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces few blooms, which are often pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
